data.text: 01:35 The Power 1984. Horror. Directed by Jeffrey Obrow & Stephen Carpenter. Stars Suzy Stokey & Warren Lincoln. A group of people become possessed by evil spirits after obtaining an ancient Aztec doll. [S] 03:20 Cellar Club with Caroline Munro Caroline Munro wraps up a petrifying evening and gives us a taster of next week's extraordinary sci-fi horrors. [S] 03:25 The Shakedown 1960. Drama. Terence Morgan plays 'Augie' a crook just released from prison and intent on getting his rackets back from 'Collar' (Harry H Corbett). Stars Bill Owen, Robert Beatty and Hazel Court. [S] 05:15 Look At Life Of Brooklands. 1965. The story of the Surrey motor racing circuit and aerodrome built near Weybridge, the world's first purpose-built motorsport venue, as well as one of Britain's first airfields. 05:25 For the Love of Ada Spring. 1970. Stars Wilfred Pickles, Irene Handl & Jack Smethurst. Walter proposes to Ada, but struggles to find the money for the ring she likes. (S1, E06) [S] 06:00 Burke's Law Who Killed 711? 1964. Directed by Sidney Lanfield. Stars Gene Barry, Gary Conway & Regis Toomey. When a shady businessman is found slain in an elevator, his accountant becomes a prime suspect. 07:00 Sailor Beware! 1956. Comedy. Director: Gordon Parry. Stars Gordon Jackson, Peggy Mount, Ronald Lewis & Shirley Eaton. A seaman gets cold feet about his wedding when his mother-in-law to be takes control. [S] 08:35 The Way of the World 1947. Drama. Directed by Jimmy Komisarjevsky. Stars Hamilton Deane, Graham Russell & Mary Perkins. A long retired director of early silent films recalls his exciting career as a filmmaker. 09:15 Once In a New Moon 1935. Sci-Fi. Stars Eliot Makeham, Rene Ray & Derrick de Marney. A small town gets dragged out into space and the populace try to organise a local government based on equal rights for all. [S] 10:30 The Buccaneers Spy Aboard. 1957. Stars Robert Shaw, Richard Johnson & Danny Green. Tempest is robbed by the ruthless pirate Peg Leg and comes to the realisation that there is a spy aboard the Sultana. [S] 11:05 Someone at the Door 1950. Crime. Director: Francis Searle. Stars Michael Medwin, Garry Marsh, Hugh Latimer. Ronnie and Sally discover that a secret passage in their new home is also a storeroom for a gang of thieves. 12:20 Master Spy 1964. Drama. Directed By Montgomery Tully. Starring Stephen Murray. A Russian scientist working for the British is suspected of being a 'plant', sent to monitor nuclear secrets for the Communists. [S] 13:45 Look At Life 1964. A look at the modernisation of the transport system across the country, focusing on what happens to the trains and buses, the conversions of old stations and new uses for old equipment. 13:55 The Brothers The Perfect Day. 1972. Stars Jean Anderson, Derek Benfield & Terence Brook. Hammond Transport appears to be ready for further expansion, that is until an unexpected crisis occurs. [S] 15:00 Saddle Up! Join James Stephens way out west for an afternoon of drama, action and a little romance. We begin in the company of Randolph Scott, Ann Dvorak and Rhonda Fleming in Abilene Town from 1946. [S] 15:05 Abilene Town 1946. Western. Directed by Edwin L. Marin. Stars Randolph Scott, Ann Dvorak & Edgar Buchanan. Post Civil War in Abilene, a sheriff attempts to stop conflict between the homesteaders and cattlemen. [S] 16:45 The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp Marshal Earp Meets General Lee. 1955. Stars Hugh O'Brian & Don Haggerty. A former Confederate officer threatens to destroy Ellsworth if Wyatt is not stripped of his badge and run out of town. 17:20 Bonanza The Last Viking. 1960. Stars Pernell Roberts, Neville Brand & Sonya Wilde. A long-lost relative visits the Cartwrights, but a band of criminals led by him kidnap Little Joe and his girlfriend. [S] 18:25 The Texan The Troubled Town. 1958. Stars Rory Calhoun, Pat Conway & James Drury. A hot-headed man, embarrassed that he's been caught cheating at cards, provokes a barroom brawl and is quickly thrashed. 19:00 Dixon of Dock Green Conspiracy. 1975. Stars Jack Warner, Andrew Burt, Pat Ashton & Jon Laurimore. Dixon and Crawford face a dilemma when they find a PC liaising with a suspected criminal. [S] 20:05 The Human Jungle Struggle for a Mind. 1965. Stars Herbert Lom. A woman rescued from a suicide bid on the London Underground, finds herself in a psychiatric clinic. Guest stars Joan Collins & Clifford Evans. [S] 21:05 Crime Story The Prince: The Life and Crimes of Darius Guppy. 1993. Stars James Purefoy & Jo Stone-Fewings. The story of Darius Guppy and his plan to stage a jewellery heist to reclaim insurance money. [S] 22:10 Carry On Spying 1964. Comedy. Directed by Gerald Thomas. Stars Kenneth Williams, Barbara Windsor & Bernard Cribbins. A British spy and his pupils are sent to track down a stolen top secret chemical formula. [S] 23:55 Tell Me Another Stories About Showbusiness Colleagues. 1976. Personal anecdotes as told to Dick Hills. This episode stars Ray Alan, Marti Caine, Roy Hudd and David Jacobs. [S] 01:35 Silent Rage 1982. Action. Directed by Michael Miller. Stars Chuck Norris, Ron Silver & Steven Keats. A sheriff goes on the hunt for a crazed murderer who has been given the power to self-heal. [S] 03:40 Quatermass 2 1957. Sci-fi Horror. Directed by Val Guest. Stars Brian Donlevy, John Longden & Sidney James. Whilst gathering support for a new project, Professor Quatermass discovers a strange 'meteor shower'. [S] 05:25 One Step Beyond The Dead Part of the House.1959. Starring Philip Abbott, Joanne Linville and Mimi Gibson. After the death of her mother, a young girl makes friends with three mysterious dolls in the nursery... [S] 06:00 Bulldog Drummond's Peril 1938. Mystery. Directed by James P. Hogan. Stars John Barrymore, John Howard & Louise Campbell. Captain Drummond puts his wedding on hold to hunt down a group of dangerous jewel thieves. [S] 07:20 Lazybones 1935. Comedy. Directed by Michael Powell. Stars Ian Hunter, Claire Luce & Bernard Nedell. Reg is expected to marry a wealthy American but she has been swindled and is penniless. [S] 08:35 The First Travelling Saleslady 1956. Comedy Western. A corset store owner goes broke and becomes a traveling sales lady in Texas 1897. Starring Ginger Rogers, Barry Nelson and a young Clint Eastwood. 10:25 Be My Guest 1965. Comedy. Directed by Lance Comfort. Stars Steve Marriott, David Hemmings, Andrea Monet. Dave, ex-member of pop group 'The Smart Alecs', meets Erica, an attractive young woman seeking fame. [S] 12:05 White Cradle Inn 1947. Drama. Director: Harold French. Stars Michael Rennie & Madeleine Carroll. During the war, children were evacuated beneath the Swiss Alps, one of which is billeted with the local Inn owners. [S] 13:45 What the Butler Saw 1950. Comedy. Director: Godfrey Grayson. Stars Edward Rigby, Henry Mollison, Michael Ward. An Earl returns from a tropical island and finds a tribal king's daughter has stowed away in his luggage. 15:00 Crown Court The Mugging of Arthur Simmons - Part 1. 1973. Stars Edward Jewesbury, Gyearbuor Asante & Gregory Munroe. Two young black youths and are on trial for the mugging of an elderly man. [S] 15:30 Crown Court The Mugging of Arthur Simmons - Part 2. 1973. Stars Charles Keating, John Comer & Cyril Shaps. P.C. Kershaw takes to the stand to detail the defendant's arrest, but how will his evidence hold up? [S] 16:00 Crown Court The Mugging of Arthur Simmons - Part 3. 1973. Stars Gregory Munroe, Gabrielle Daye & Elizabeth Adare. John Dempsey faces an aggressive cross examination after giving evidence in his defence. [S] 16:30 Enemy At The Door The Polish Affaire.1978. Stars: Alfred Burke, Bernard Horsfall & Emily Richard. Retired diplomat Sir James Prideaux resists Reinicke's efforts to make him divulge British government information. [S] 17:35 The Long Memory 1953. Drama. Directed by Robert Hamer. Stars John Mills, Elizabeth Sellars, John McCallum & Geoffrey Keen. Released from prison after 12 years, a man seeks revenge on those who lied at his trial. [S] 19:35 Look At Life 1963. A captivating look at the plans for closer co-ordination between our roads, railways and coastal shipping. 20:00 The Brothers Power For Sale. 1974. Stars Patrick O'Connell, Jonathan Newth & Michael Turner. Ted is floored by Jennifer's announcement and Dutch businessman Van Der Moewe is introduced to the Board. [S] 21:05 Van der Valk Dead on Arrival. Stars Barry Foster, Joanna Dunham & Nigel Stock. A Dutch clairvoyant, adept at solving crimes is requested to visit England to help in an eight-year-old murder inquiry. [S] 22:10 Margery and Gladys 2003. Comedy/Drama. Director: Geoffrey Sax. Stars Penelope Keith, June Brown & Alan David. A wealthy housewife and her maid go on the run after attacking a house burglar and leaving him for dead. 02:05 Wish You Were Here 1987. Drama. Directed by David Leland. Stars Emily Lloyd, Jesse Birdsall & Tom Bell. Coming of age story about a rebellious young girl growing up in post-war England in a small seaside town. [S] 03:50 Second Chorus 1941. Musical. Two college students are forced to earn a living by joining a band. (Nominated for 2 Oscars). Stars: Fred Astaire, Paulette Goddard, Artie Shaw & Burgess Meredith. [S] 05:35 Canal Capers A charming short film featuring a picturesque journey on a barge down the Grand Union Canal. 06:00 Scott of the Antarctic 1948. Adventure. Directed by Charles Frend. Stars John Mills, Derek Bond & Diana Churchill. The story of British explorer Robert Falcon Scott and his quest to be the first to reach the South Pole. [S] 08:10 Meet John Doe 1941. Drama. Directed by Frank Capra. Stars Gary Cooper, Barbara Stanwyck & Edward Arnold. A drifter finds himself at the centre of a political movement after becoming part of a fraudulent story. [S] 10:40 Next To No Time 1958. Comedy. Stars Kenneth More, Betsy Drake, Irene Handl & Sid James. Whilst on the Queen Elizabeth to New York, David must close a deal before the boat docks. [S] 12:30 The Four Just Men The Man with the Golden Touch. 1960. Stars Vittorio De Sica, Richard O' Sullivan & Philip Latham. A boy is arrested on suspicion of stealing a valuable urn, but Ricco searches for the real thief. [S] 13:05 Nearest and Dearest 1972. Comedy. Directed by John Robins. Stars Hylda Baker, Jimmy Jewel & Edward Malin. After their father's death, two siblings inherit a decrepit pickle factory and attempt to keep it afloat. 14:50 Look At Life 1964. A close look at the work of demolition men and how their jobs involve both knocking down and clearing away. 15:05 The Small Back Room 1949. Drama. Directors Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger. Stars David Farrar, Jack Hawkins and Kathleen Byron. The best bomb disposal expert must battle his inner self, during the German raids. [S] 17:15 Look At Life 1960. A detailed look at roofing in London and across the country, with a focus on traditional roofing crafts, various types of roofs for different buildings and how the work is completed. 17:30 The Angry Silence 1960. Drama. Director: Guy Green. Stars: Richard Attenborough, Pier Angeli, Michael Craig & Bernard Lee. Tom Curtis works at a factory but refuses to participate in an unofficial strike. [S] 19:30 Never Look Back 1952. Drama. Director: Francis Searle. Stars Rosamund John, Hugh Sinclair, Guy Middleton. A female lawyer puts her reputation on the line to defend her ex-boyfriend who has been accused of murder. 21:00 Cellar Club with Caroline Munro Caroline Munro returns for thrilling night of mysteries and terror. Tonight, she introduces In Possession, directed by Val Guest and starring Carol Lynley, Christopher Cazenove & David Healy. [S] 21:10 Hammer House of Mystery and Suspense ... and Suspense. In Possession. 1984. Stars Carol Lynley, Christopher Cazenove, David Healy. A couple becomes trapped in a replay of a sinister event that happened in their apartment in the past. [S] 22:40 Cellar Club with Caroline Munro After a suspenseful night, Caroline Munro closes the door to the Cellar Club once more, but not before letting you in on what's coming up next week. [S] 22:45 Jack The Ripper Part 1 of 2. 1988. Drama. Stars Michael Caine, Armand Assante & Ray McAnally. Chief Inspector Frederick Abberline is assigned to investigate the murder of a prostitute in the East End of London. [S] 02:45 Human Desire 1954. Drama. Director: Fritz Lang. Stars Glenn Ford, Gloria Grahame, Broderick Crawford. A railroad engineer is drawn into a deadly romantic triangle with a hard-drinking rival and his young wife. [S] 04:35 Stadium Thrills A fascinating collection of short films featuring a number of thrilling motorcycle races and informative commentary. 05:00 Bonanza Breed of Violence. 1960. Stars Michael Landon, Myrna Fahey & John Ericson. Dolly Kincaid welcomes the chance to leave town with a handsome stranger, unaware that he's a bank robber. [S] 06:00 Lily of Killarney 1934. Set in Ireland, a poor Landowner's rival frames him for a murder. Stars John Garrick & Stanley Holloway is well suited to his semi-comic role as a baritone Father O'Flynn. 07:35 Cornish Ramble 1946. Directed by Paul Barralet. A Travelogue of Cornwall in the late 1940s. A place where superstition and legend are part of a way of life. We visit many of the famous landmarks and a Tin mine. 07:55 The Beverly Hillbillies Jed Buys the Freeway. 1963. Stars Buddy Ebsen, Jesse White & Max Baer Jr. The Clampetts are visited by a stranger looking to get rich by selling Jed different monuments in the Los Angeles area. [S] 08:30 Black Saddle 1959. Client: Martinez. Western with Peter Breck. After his brothers are killed in a shootout, a gunfighter decides to hang up his guns and uphold the law by becoming a lawyer. Saturday Morgning Pictures 09:00 Batman When the Rat's Away, the Mice Will Play. 1966. Stars Adam West, Neil Hamilton & Frank Gorshin. Riddler sends word to Commissioner Gordon about a time bomb, and he calls upon Bruce Wayne for help. [S] 09:30 The Three Musketeers The Measure of a Man. 1933. Stars John Wayne & Ruth Hall. Elaine goes to headquarters to present Tom's evidence against Duval, and El Shaitan plots to stop Tom interfering with his plans. [S] 09:50 Space Patrol The Buried Spaceship. 1964. Stars Libby Morris. Dick Vosburgh & Ronnie Stevens. Operation Ice Cube begins when Marla suggests moving ice through space as a solution to a drought problem on Mars. [S] 10:20 Danny The Dragon Dragon Hunt. 1967. Stars Sally Thomsett, Christopher Cooper. The net is closing in on Danny, and he is hungry! But not for food! The children go off to find some for him, he goes walkabout again! [S] 10:40 The Coveted Coat 1924. Drama. Directed by Gaston Quiribet. Early short produced by Cecil Hepworth about a tramp who persuades another tramp to let him have a coat off a scarecrow by persuading him it's haunted. [S] 11:00 The Adventures of Robin Hood The Double. 1958. Stars Richard Greene, John Gabriel & Pamela Alan. When one of Robin Hood's sworn enemies arrives at Nottingham Castle, he tells the sheriff his plan to get rid of the outlaw. [S] 11:30 The Buccaneers Hurricane. 1957. Stars Robert Shaw, Derek Sydney & Ewen Solon. As New Providence recovers from a hurricane, word spreads that a treasure ship has sunk nearby. Tempest decides to seek the gold. [S] 12:00 Hawkeye & the Last of the Mohicans The Morristown Story. 1957. Directed by Sam Newfield. Stars John Hart, Lon Chaney Jr & George Barnes. Hawkeye has tracked outlaw Simon Girty to Morristown but he and Chingachgook are turned away. [S] 12:30 The Giant Claw 1957. Sci-fi. Directed by Fred F. Sears. Stars Jeff Morrow, Mara Corday & Morris Ankrum. A giant extraterrestrial bird arrives on Earth and leaves a trail of death and destruction in its wake. [S] 14:05 R.A.F. 1935. Documentary. Directed by John Betts. Commentator: Squadron Leader W. Helmore. Documentary about the Royal Air Force featuring training of new recruits and aircraft of the period. [S] 15:00 Captain Scarlet and the Mysterons Lunarville 7. 1967. Stars Cy Grant, Ed Bishop & David Healy. When the Lunar Controller claims he can negotiate peace between the Moon and the Mysterons, the team are sent out to investigate. 15:35 Gallant Journey 1946. Drama. Directed by William A. Wellman. Stars Glenn Ford, Janet Blair & Charlie Ruggles. Biopic of US aviation pioneer John J. Montgomery who battled the odds to build a successful glider. 17:20 Lost Lagoon 1958. Drama. Directed by John Rawlins. Stars Jeffrey Lynn, Leila Barry & Peter Donat. An unhappy husband dreaming of escape becomes a castaway on an island after his boat runs into a storm. [S] 18:55 Cinebox Memories In this wonderful music video from the 60s, Italian singer and actress Mina performs Pesci Rossi. 19:00 Dixon of Dock Green Legacy. 1976. Stars Tom Adams, Patrick Jordan & Carlos Douglas. After years in prison, Jack Montelbetti is released. He returns home, only to find the body of a jewel thief in his flat. [S] 20:00 Budgie Do Me A Favour. Stars: Adam Faith, Iain Cuthbertson & Lynn Dalby. Hazel's cousin Herbert arrives in London and Budgie is bribed into taking him on a guided tour. [S] 21:05 Wuthering Heights 1998. Drama. Directed by David Skynner. Stars Orla Brady, Robert Cavanah & Peter Davison. An adaptation of Emily BrontÃ«'s timeless tale of a love so powerful that it reaches beyond the grave. 23:25 The Edgar Wallace Mystery Theatre The Double. 1963. Directed by Lionel Harris. Stars Jeanette Sterke, Robert Brown & Basil Henson. John Cleeve is suffering from 'Homicidal Hallucinations' and can't remember his past. [S] 02:50 The Secret of Seagull Island 1982. Drama. Directed by Nestore Ungaro. Stars Jeremy Brett, Prunella Ransome & Nicky Henson. In Rome, a woman embarks on a chilling journey to find her blind sister who mysteriously disappeared. 04:55 Sherlock Holmes The Case of the Winthrop Legend. 1954. Starring: Ronald Howard, Howard Marion-Crawford & Archie Duncan. The Winthrop family legend foretells the death of anyone who finds silver coins. [S] 05:30 The Law & Mr Jones Accidental Tourist. Created by Sy Gomberg. Stars James Whitmore, Janet De Gore & Conlan Carter. Abraham Jones is an attorney handling white collar cases from star studded clients. 06:00 Woman On The Run 1950. Drama. Directed by Norman Foster. Stars Ann Sheridan, Dennis O'Keefe & Robert Keith. An eyewitness to a murder is pursued by his wife, the police and the killer around San Francisco. [S] 07:35 McLintock 1963. Western. Director: Andrew V. McLaglen. Stars John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara & Patrick Wayne. Wealthy rancher McLintock uses his power and influence to keep the peace between conflicting groups. [S] 12:00 The Woman in Green 1945. Mystery. Director: Roy William Neill. Stars: Basil Rathbone and Henry Daniell. Sherlock Holmes investigates the mysterious murders of women, all of whom have their forefinger severed. [S] 13:25 Batman When the Rat's Away, the Mice Will Play. 1966. Stars Adam West, Neil Hamilton & Frank Gorshin. Riddler sends word to Commissioner Gordon about a time bomb, and he calls upon Bruce Wayne for help. [S] 14:00 The Adventures of Robin Hood Castle in the Air. 1958. Stars Richard Greene, Ian Hunter & Patricia Burke. When a Knight finds himself in trouble after losing a high stakes gambling game, he turns to Robin for help. [S] 14:30 Campbell's Kingdom 1957. Drama. Directed by Ralph Thomas. Stars Dirk Bogarde, Stanley Baker, Michael Craig, Barbara Murray & John Laurie. A Canadian Rockies landowner leads the fight against a dam builder. [S] 16:30 Out of Town Sheep Dogs/Gun Collection. 1981. On a bitterly cold day, Jack Hargreaves travels to Wales for a sheep dog trial. Back in Hampshire he visits a collection of guns from the 'wild west' of America. [S] 17:00 The Footage Detectives There's brilliant footage of the late Peter Rogers, an interview of Bryan Forbes, a fascinating reel of a day in the life of the Lily laundry, and we go back to the Granada Mansfield in the 60s. [S] 18:00 Cromwell 1970. Drama. Directed by Ken Hughes. Stars Richard Harris, Alec Guinness & Robert Morley. Politician and soldier, Oliver Cromwell, rises from the ranks to lead a civil war against King Charles I. 20:50 Look At Life 1960. A look into the popularity of ten-pin bowling, especially among women, with glimpses of the new bowling centre on the pier in Southend and a centre for travellers and staff at London Airport. 21:00 Love for Lydia Episode 5. 1977. Stars Mel Martin, Michael Aldridge & Jeremy Irons. Lydia grows tired of going to society dances with Edward and his friends, and he fumes over her mesmerising effect on everyone. 22:05 Valentino 1951. Biography. Directed by Lewis Allen. Stars Eleanor Parker, Otto Kruger & Anthony Dexter. The story of Rudolph Valentino and his rise from obscurity to fame, and the struggles that followed. 01:15 Treasure Hunt 1952. Comedy. Director: John Paddy Carstairs. Stars Jimmy Edwards, Martita Hunt, Naunton Wayne & Athene Seyler. After reading Sir Roderick Lyall's will, the family learn they are short on money. [S] 02:50 Black Tuesday 1954. Drama. Directed by Hugo Fregonese. Stars Edward G. Robinson, Jean Parker & Peter Graves. A death row inmate breaks free on the eve of his execution, but will the law catch up with him? 04:30 Our Girl Friday 1953. Comedy. Director Noel Langley. Stars Joan Collins, George Cole, Kenneth More & Hattie Jacques. A British cast lead this story about a shipwrecked group on a tropical island. [S] 06:00 Stagecoach West The Bold Whip. Wayne Rogers & Robert Bray run a stagecoach line in the Old West, where they come across a wide variety of killers, robbers and ladies in distress. [S] 07:00 The Black Book 1949. Thriller. Directed by Anthony Mann. Stars Robert Cummings, Richard Basehart & Richard Hart. A powerful man desperately searches for his black book, a list of those marked for the guillotine. [S] 08:50 Look At Life 1960. A look at the British country market, including cattle markets and the problems they face. 09:00 The Pointing Finger 1933. Drama. Directed by George Pearson. Stars John Stuart, Viola Keats & Leslie Perrins. A nobleman, aspiring to becoming an earl, devises an evil scheme to murder his relative. [S] 10:20 Lunch Hour 1961. Comedy. Shirley Anne Field gives a great performance as a young designer on the brink of an affair with a married executive (Robert Stephens) at the company she works for. Stars Kay Walsh. [S] 11:35 The Outer Limits Cold Hands, Warm Heart. 1964. Stars William Shatner, Geraldine Brooks & Lloyd Gough. The first man to land on Venus returns to Earth, but suddenly finds himself falling into a nightmare. [S] 12:40 What's On TPTV With Noel Founder of Talking Pictures TV and one half of the Footage Detectives, Noel Cronin, shares shows and films not be missed throughout the end of August. [S] 12:55 Ramrod 1947. Western. Connie Dickson (Veronica Lake) plans to marry a sheep rancher, but her father teams up with land baron Frank Ivey to drive the man out of town. [S] 14:45 Look At Life ...At the End of a Rope. 1963. A detailed look at the story of the rope and its many uses in the world of today. 15:00 The Saint The Imprudent Politician. 1964. Stars Roger Moore, Anthony Bate & Jennifer Wright. A politician's wife asks Simon for help after her husband's indiscretion results in a blackmail plot. [S] 16:05 The Gambler and the Lady 1952. Crime. Directed by Patrick Jenkins & Sam Newfield. Stars Dane Clark, Kathleen Byron & Naomi Chance. A gambler attempts to put his past behind him to impress a wealthy girl he has fallen for. [S] 17:35 A Lifetime Ago with The Baim Collection ... Baim Collection. York. 1972. Valentine Dyall tells us about York, an ancient city steeped in history. Whilst its outlook is to the next century, it retains the atmosphere of its heritage. [S] 18:00 For the Love of Ada Wedding Plans. Stars Wilfred Pickles, Irene Handl & Jack Smethurst. Needing more money for the wedding and honeymoon, Ada gets a job at the town hall, and Walter is expecting a rise. (S2, E01) [S] 18:30 Out of Town Sheep Dogs/Gun Collection. 1981. On a bitterly cold day, Jack Hargreaves travels to Wales for a sheep dog trial. Back in Hampshire he visits a collection of guns from the 'wild west' of America. [S] 19:00 The Footage Detectives We have a look at recycling in the 60s, a 50s reel of a housewife that deserves an award, there's a story based on a tin of pineapple slices and an unknown reel of family life in the 60s. [S] 20:00 Enemy At The Door Angels That Soar Above. 1978. Stars: Alfred Burke, Bernard Horsfall & Emily Richard. Hauptmann Anders is accused of supposedly passing on details of troop movements to Marguerite. [S] 21:05 Wuthering Heights 1998. Drama. Directed by David Skynner. Stars Orla Brady, Robert Cavanah & Peter Davison. An adaptation of Emily BrontÃ«'s timeless tale of a love so powerful that it reaches beyond the grave. [S] 23:25 Bagdad CafÃ© 1987. Comedy. Director: Percy Adlon. Stars Marianne SÃ¤gebrecht, CCH Pounder & Jack Palance. A Bavarian woman, abandoned by her husband in the desert, finds an unexpected oasis at the Bagdad CafÃ©. 02:00 Maigret Maigret Goes to School. 2002. Stars Bruno Cremer, Jean-Claude Dreyfus & Carole Richert. Maigret goes to a small town after reading a letter from the son of a teacher who's been accused of murder. [S] 03:50 Fools Rush In 1955. Drama. Director: Victor H. Komow. Stars Frank Silvera, Ken Buckridge & Jean Alexander. A ship with a cargo full of diamonds gets taken over by pirates. [S] 04:45 Look At Life 1960. Exploring the effect of soot on our lives, especially on the erosion of buildings. 05:00 The Lloyd Bridges Show The Skippy Mannox Story. 1962. Lloyd Bridges introduces a news event, either current or the past, discussing its relevance. Stars Jeff Bridges & Dub Taylor. Created by: Aaron Spelling. 05:30 Dangerous Assignment The Memory Chain. 1951. Stars Brian Donlevy, Robert R. Stephenson & Jeanne Bates. Steve travels to Munich to try and break an espionage ring that leaks secret information by word of mouth. [S] 06:00 Arrest Bulldog Drummond 1938. Mystery. Directed by James P. Hogan. Stars John Howard, Heather Angel & H.B. Warner. Captain Drummond must act fast when he discovers the theft of a destructive invention. [S] 07:10 Ticket To Paradise 1961. Romance. Director: Francis Searle. Stars: Emrys Jones, Patricia Dainton & Denis Shaw. The film tells the story of romance between a travel agent and a tourist on holiday in Italy. [S] 08:25 Petticoat Lane 1950s Glimpses: Directed by JB Grainger around the late 1950s. The empty market in the early morning; barrows being wheeled in, people bringing their goods in taxis, others carrying parcels. 08:40 Doctor At Large 1957. Comedy. Directed by Ralph Thomas. Stars Dirk Bogarde, Muriel Pavlow & Donald Sinden. The hilarious misadventures of Dr. Simon Sparrow as he sets off into the world after graduating. [S] 10:30 Five Days 1954. Crime. Directed by Montgomery Tully. Stars Dane Clark, Cecile Chevreau & Paul Carpenter. A man on the verge of bankruptcy pays his friend to organise a hit on him, but will his plan pay off? [S] 12:00 Worzel Gummidge Moving On. 1980. Stars Jon Pertwee, Una Stubbs & Mike Berry. The Braithwaites return from holiday to find the farm a mess, courtesy of Worzel and Aunt Sally. Can they avoid getting into trouble? [S] 12:35 Shepherd On The Rock 1993. Drama. Directed by Bob Keen. Starring Bernard Hill, John Bowles and Betsy Brantley. A sheep farmer and his family fight for their land against the persistent efforts of a land developer. [S] 14:35 The House In Marsh Road 1960. Horror. Director Montgomery Tully and starring Patricia Dainton, Sam Kydd and Sandra Dorne. Jean is left a house and hopes it will be the fresh start they need but the house has other ideas. [S] 15:55 The Thirty Nine Steps 1978. Crime. Director: Don Sharp. Stars Robert Powell, Karen Dotrice, David Warner & John Mills. An engineer attempts to prevent Prussian agents from executing a political assassination. [S] 17:55 The Beverly Hillbillies The Family Tree. 1963. Stars Irene Ryan, Rosemary DeCamp & Harriet E. MacGibbon. The head of a 'first family' historical society becomes enchanted by the Clampetts antiques and their way of life. [S] 18:30 Scotland Yard 1960. The Dover Road Mystery. Directed by Gerard Bryant. Starring Geoffrey Keen, Edward Cast and Leonard Sachs. A stolen car used in a bank robbery proves too fast for the squad car. (S1, E32) 19:05 Batman The Penguin's a Jinx. 1966. Stars Adam West, Lewis Charles & Burgess Meredith. Narrowly escaping a fiery death, Batman and Robin figure out the Penguin's next move is to kidnap a famous actress. [S] 19:35 Dangerous Assignment The Parachute Story. 1952. Stars Brian Donlevy, Kristine Miller, John Dehner. Steve parachutes into Eastern Europe to expose the truth about a leader who was falsely accused of spying for the U.S. [S] 20:05 Rumpole of the Bailey Rumpole and the Learned Friends. Stars: Leo McKern, Peggy Thorpe-Bates, Joanna Van Gyseghem. Rumpole accuses a dishonest policeman of framing his client and finds himself in legal trouble. 21:10 A Month of Sundays 1989. Drama/Comedy. Directed by Allan Kroeker. Stars Hume Cronyn, Vincent Gardenia & Tandy Cronyn. A perceptive drama by award-winning playwright Bob Larbey, about coming to terms with old age. 23:10 Cellar Club with Caroline Munro Caroline Munro offers some horrifying treats - an experiment gone wrong and a vicious alien predator. First up, is the 1958 sci-fi horror The Fly, which stars Vincent Price and Patricia Owens. [S] 23:15 The Fly 1958. Sci-fi Horror. Director: Kurt Neumann. Stars David Hedison, Vincent Price & Patricia Owens. A keen scientist has a horrifying accident when he tests his newly invented teleportation device. [S] 01:10 Deadly Instincts 1997. Horror. Director: Paul Matthews. Stars Todd Jensen, Samantha Womack & Oliver Tobias. A malevolent alien crash lands on Earth and begins preying on the students and staff on a college campus. [S] 03:00 Cellar Club with Caroline Munro Caroline Munro takes a quick look at next week's thrilling horrors before closing up for the night. [S] 03:05 Plague of the Zombies 1966. Horror. Directed by John Gilling. Stars AndrÃ© Morell, Diane Clare & Brook Williams. A medical professor arrives in a remote Cornish village to study a strange plague affecting the villagers.
